text: Has anyone built modules/partials that requiere login so we can use CRM data in it?
I don't see anything in the docs mentioning this so would then workaround be to use HubL to create the variables and then pass it as props to the {% js_partial %}

Same as it can be on the json cms fields
In the official docs, it shares an example with an array. For a repeated field group.

Still could mean its not possible since ive found bugs in the doc before, the json fields dont allow it so itâ€™d make sense that these wouldnt either. Regardless seems like a small drawback to focus soo much effort on this

Just create a default_content object at the top level and use that in development with the provided hook

I would ideally use the correct behaviour as referenced in the docs, and if the docs are out of date they should be made aware and remove it.
Whats the type error that you have on the component?

Ok now it works fine remotely...

does `hublData` have access to `hublParameters`?

I'm trying to pass a value into a module from a template and then use that value in hublData

I'm unblocked for now.

The default values prop is still broken, so bug report here.

But I managed to solve my issues, and I found out it was related to compiling of tailwind. So I just manually compiled it rather than relying on the HubSpot deploy server to do this.

I don't believe that would be accessible

Are you able to grab the template variable directly from the `hublData` template?
I don't think so, I'm trying to grab tags from a blog post. Not sure if those are potentially available if the module exists on a blog post page? How would I do that if that is possible?
At the moment I switched to moving the logic to the template itself and passing the result into the react module
Can you share a hubl snippet of the data you are trying to pass?
```{{ content.tag_list }}```
`export const hublDataTemplate = `{% set hublData = content.tag_list %}``
Is this what you're trying to do?
yea
and the id of the blog post itself I think would be necessary but not sure yet
if `content` is expected to be populated on your template, then you should be able to access it in your hublData template, no need to pass it to your module as a parameter
oh, nice
testing that nowâ€”I'm essentially trying to recreate a related posts module with some additional rules
<@UAYBXDG4U> <@U04DLJH3W94>  could use your help on this

Can you make a module a global module with cms-react? Or do they all have to be local modules.

(for example for a header/footer where you want the marketing manager to be able to update in the UI)
Yes, you can make a global React module with `"global": true` in the `meta` export
